extendedIngredients.name: cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup sour cream (or plain, whole coconut yogurt)

extendedIngredients.name: ghee
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 tablespoons unsalted butter or ghee, melted and cooled slightly

recipes.title: Cheesy Jalapeño “Cornbread” (Grain-Free, Paleo)

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel are great choices for Cornbread. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. One wine you could try is Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese
productMatches.description: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese is made from late-harvestedRiesling grapes in the middle Mosel Valley of Germany. These grapes hang into late Autumn and ripen such that they produce a rich, full-bodied white wine. This is an elegant Riesling that offers a palate of different stone and tree fruit notes such as peach and apricot. It is luscious and full-bodied with a long and fresh finish.An ideal dinner Riesling and also can be enjoyed withriper, aged cheeses and spicy cuisine due to its enhancedcomplexity.Blend: 100% Riesling

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F and adjust rack to middle position of oven. Butter an 8 x 8-inch baking dish. Whisk almond flour, coconut flour baking powder, sea salt, baking soda and coconut sugar together in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, butter, and sour cream. Pour sour cream mixture, jalapeños and onions into flour mixture and gently fold all ingredients together. Pour half of the cornbread batter into the baking dish and spread out evenly. Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top, and then pour the remaining batter on top. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425°F and adjust rack to middle position of oven. Butter an 8 x 8-inch baking dish.
Whisk almond flour, coconut flour baking powder, sea salt, baking soda and coconut sugar together in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, butter, and sour cream.
Pour sour cream mixture, jalapeños and onions into flour mixture and gently fold all ingredients together.
Pour half of the cornbread batter into the baking dish and spread out evenly. Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top, and then pour the remaining batter on top.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
